result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven K. Lehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Record Update

Defendant Steve K Lehman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.   David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF35, 13CF408, 14CF180 and 14CF226.

8:44 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Kessler indicates that there should be a change on PSI on page 3, paragraph 3 and page 10, paragraph 3.
Atty Knaapen has no corrections.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendent makes a statement on his behalf before sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF35:
Count 1 -
Sentence imposed/stayed 3 years - 1 year 6 months initial confinement and 1 year 6 months extended supervision
24 months probation
60 days county jail
Jail credit of 62 days
Huber priveleges for work and counseling
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Sign all necessary releases.
All prescriptions from one pharmacy.
Maintain full-time employment.  School only if part-time must work full-time.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay costs -victim witness surcharge/filing fee  
Submit to a DNA Sample, unless already completed
Cash bond can be applied to costs any remaining bond monies can be applied to other cases
If gets revoked would be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program - eligible after 18 months

Count 2 - DRI

13CF408:
Count 1 -
Prison for 4 years 6 months - initial confinement 2 years 6 months and extended supervision 2 years - Imposed/Stayed
Probation 24 months concurrent
90 day county jail, concurrent to 13CF35 - commence within 90 days of today's date
No pretrial incarceration credit
Huber priveleges for employment and counseling
Pay Costs - victim witness surcharge
Comply with conditions of probation in 13CF35

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
4 years 6 months concurrent to count 1 - initial confinement 2 years 6 months and extended supervision 2 years - Imposed/Stayed
Concurrent with 13CF35 case
24 months probation concurrent
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program - eligible after 18 months 
Comply with conditions of probation in 13CF35

14CF180:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 -
Pay fine of $100 + costs to include the DNA surcharge, Victim witness surcharge and filing fee
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
zero jail
zero suspension

14CF226:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence being served
24 months probation concurrent 
3 days jail credit 
Huber for employment and counseling
Comply with the same conditions in 13CF35
Pay costs to include DNA surcharge, Victim witness surcharge and filing fee
Submit to DNA sample if not already completed
Any monies on deposit for this case to be applied to the costs **to be applied to 14CF180 first

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence being served 
24 months probation concurrent 
Comply with conditions inf 13CF35 
Huber for employment and counseling
Submit to DNA sample if not already completed 
Pay costs to include DNA surcharge, Victim witness surcharge and filing fee

Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Sentencing hearing on December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steve K Lehman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF35, 13CF408, 14CF180, 14CF226
1:37 p.m.  Court calls case. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Defendant arrived late and Atty Kessler has not had a chance to review the PSI with her client. 
Court questions the parties. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  
Atty Kessler makes statements to the Court. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steve K Lehman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF35, 13CF408, 14CF180 and 14CF226.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF35: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

13CF408:
Count 1 (amended) - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest

14CF180:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest

14CF226:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on 13CF35 Count 1, 13CF408 Count 1 & 3, 14CF180 Count 3 and 14CF226 Count 1 & 2  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
PSI ordered.
PSI to be completed by October 31, 2014 and copies forwarded to Counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond continued.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steve K Lehman in court with attorney Sheila J Kessler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Law Intern Taylor Krause appears for the State of Wisconsin and states the appearances of the parties. Case 14CF226 will be heard for a preliminary and arraignment.  Then all cases 13CF35, 13CF408, 14CF180, 14CF226 will be scheduled for pretrial on 07-28-14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
